Kris s staršema jutri na letalo za ZDA
05 Nov 2019, 16:28 by Spletno uredništvo

Težko pričakovani dan D je naposled pred vrati. 21-mesečni Kris Zudich bo s staršema Ano Jerak in Matteom Zudichem jutri opoldne z Brnika odpotoval na kliniko UCLA v Los Angelesu, kjer bo prejel odmerek zdravila Zolgensma.



Jutri se bo družina Jerak-Zudich poslovila od domačega Markovca in se za vsaj mesec dni preselila v ZDA z upanjem, da bo drago zdravilo ustavilo Krisovo bolezen.  Foto: Tomaž Primožič/FPA

KOPER > Kot je znano, bo družina letela v ZDA z zasebnim letalom srbskega poslovneža Miodraga Kostića. Krisa bo na poti v ZDA spremljal tudi zdravnik, ki bo prisoten tudi ob vrnitvi družine domov.
Koliko časa bo družina ostala v ZDA, je odvisno od Krisovega odziva na revolucionarno zdravilo, ki so ga razvili v ZDA in je v ameriški klinični študiji ustavilo bolezen pri 36 dojenčkih z najhujšo obliko spinalne mišične atrofije, ki je prizadela tudi Krisa. Kot nam je nedavno dejala Krisova mama Ana Jerak, predvidevajo, da bo bivanje v ZDA trajalo najmanj mesec ali dva, morda celo več.
V Zvezi prijateljev mladine Slovenije (ZPMS) so prav danes poravnali račun za zdravilo, ki ga je izdala klinika UCLA. “Abanka je poskrbela za res ugoden menjalni tečaj, tako da je cena za zdravilo v evrih znašala malenkost več kot okrogla dva milijona evrov,” je pojasnila generalna sekretarka ZPMS Breda Krašna. Kot dodaja, bodo jutri javnosti sporočili natančne podatke o plačilu za zdravilo in za ostale stroške, vključno z vizami in spremstvom zdravnika, ki so jih že poravnali danes, ter o stroških bivanja družine, za katere še čakajo predračun in jih bodo predvidoma plačali jutri.
Društvo Palčica pomagalčica je pred tednom dni na račun ZPMS nakazalo 2,3 miljona evrov. Prejeli so tudi 50.000 evrov s strani sponzorja in še nekaj donacij, namenjenih Krisovemu zdravljenju. “Za zdaj je denarja za vse stroške, povezane s Krisovim zdravljenjem, dovolj,” zatrjuje Breda Krašna. Preostanek zneska, zbranega v dobrodelni akciji, približno 1,7 milijona evrov, pa Palčica Pomagalčica hrani na svojem računu.
text:
Chris with his parents on a plane to the US tomorrow
05 Nov 2019, 16:28 by Web Editing

The highly anticipated day D is finally out the door. 21-month-old Kris Zudich will travel with her parents Ana Jerak and Matte Zudich tomorrow at Brnik to UCLA Clinic in Los Angeles to receive a dose of Zolgensma.



Tomorrow, the Jerak-Zudich family will say goodbye to their native Markovac and move to the US for at least a month with the hope that expensive medicine will stop Chris's illness. Photo: Tomaz Primozic / FPA

KOPER> As you know, the family will fly to the US with a private jet from Serbian businessman Miodrag Kostic. On the way to the USA, Krisa will be accompanied by a doctor who will also be present when the family returns home.
How long a family will stay in the US depends on Kris' response to a groundbreaking drug developed in the US that stopped a disease in 36 US infants with the worst form of spinal muscular atrophy in a US clinical study, which also affected Kris. As Kris's mom Ana Jerak recently told us, they predict that a stay in the US will last at least a month or two, maybe even longer.
The Association of Friends of Youth of Slovenia (ZPMS) today settled a bill for a medicine issued by the UCLA Clinic. "Abanka provided a really favorable exchange rate so that the price for the medicine in euros was just over two million euros," explained ZPMS Secretary General Breda Krašna. He adds that tomorrow they will announce to the public precise information on payment for the drug and for other expenses, including visas and doctor's accompaniment, which they have already paid today, as well as the cost of living for the family, for which they are still invoiced and are expected to pay tomorrow.
A week ago, Palčica helper made a transfer to the ZPMS account of EUR 2.3 million. They also received $ 50,000 from a sponsor and some more donations to help Kris heal. "For now, there is enough money for all the costs associated with Kris' treatment," claims Brad Krašna. The rest of the amount raised in the charity campaign is about 1.7 million euros and is kept by Pomacalcica in his account.
